item.title: Labour reshuffle: Anneliese Dodds out in Starmer's post-election reshuffle
item.description: Shadow chancellor Anneliese Dodds is replaced by Rachel Reeves as Sir Keir Starmer changes his top team.

item.title: US passes emergency waiver over fuel pipeline cyber-attack
item.description: The US acts to keep fuel flowing after its largest pipeline was hit by a ransomware cyber-attack.

item.title: Lockdown: Boris Johnson to announce 17 May changes for England
item.description: Hugs and indoor gatherings could return from 17 May as Boris Johnson confirms the next stage of unlocking.

item.title: Gunman shoots dead six people at Colorado Springs birthday party
item.description: The suspect opened fire in a mobile home before taking his own life, police in the US city say.

item.title: Jerusalem protests: Netanyahu defends Israeli action after clashes with Palestinians
item.description: The prime minister spoke after two nights of clashes between Palestinian protesters and police.

item.title: Rail disruption set to continue into next week after train cracks found
item.description: Rail firms GWR and LNER warn passengers not to travel on Sunday after cracks were found on some trains.

item.title: Sir David Attenborough: Problems that await greater than the epidemic
item.description: The broadcaster calls on nations to act in agreement as he is appointed People's Advocate at COP26.

item.title: Mini umbrella firms costing UK taxpayer millions
item.description: Tens of thousands of companies are being set up with Filipino directors to benefit from UK tax relief.

item.title: Rescue operation to help whale stranded in Thames
item.description: Crowds gathered at Richmond Lock as the RNLI worked to free what's thought to be a small Minke whale.

item.title: Covid: 'Miracle' baby born to Newport mum in coma
item.description: Doctors were not sure Marriam Ahmad and her unborn daughter would survive after she was ventilated.

item.title: Kabul attack: Families bury schoolchildren of blast that killed dozens
item.description: Most of the victims of Saturday's blasts which killed more than 60 near a Kabul school were girls.

item.title: Golden Globes controversy: Scarlett Johansson joins criticism
item.description: The actress has backed a host of stars criticising the awards over how it is tackling discrimination.

item.title: The Papers: 'Starmer swings axe', and 'darling hugs of May'
item.description: Many of Monday's papers lead with Labour's reshuffle after the party's election losses in England.

item.title: Covid-19 pandemic: Sex workers in Germany 'at risk'
item.description: Sex workers in Germany say a countrywide ban on the industry forces many into poverty and danger.

item.title: Meghan warns of pandemic impact on women
item.description: The Duchess of Sussex speaks about the pandemic's impact on women.

item.title: Queen's Speech 2021: What can we expect?
item.description: Social care, building safety and immigration are set to feature in government plans for the next year.

item.title: Your pictures on the theme of 'outdoor art'
item.description: A selection of striking images from our readers on this week's theme.

item.title: Ian Cunningham: 'I'm 80 years old and still playing rugby'
item.description: At 80 years old, Ian Cunningham is one of the oldest walking rugby players in the UK.

item.title: 'Our first day of freedom on American soil'
item.description: Adrian Meza and his family from Nicaragua have just been released from detention by US border officials.

item.title: India Covid: Kumbh Mela pilgrims turn into super-spreaders
item.description: When millions turned up for the Hindu festival amid a coronavirus surge, many feared the worst.

item.title: Covid: Refugee nurses are being fast-tracked into the NHS
item.description: Walid Jarad fled persecution in Lebanon - now he's being trained to be a NHS nurse in Liverpool.

item.title: The tech helping emergency responders save lives in the pandemic
item.description: How technology has helped emergency responders save lives during the pandemic.

item.title: Office or home? The pleasure and pain of lockdown working
item.description: After a year of working from home, are you looking forward to getting back in the office or dreading it?

item.title: Hvaldimir: Seeking sanctuary for whale dubbed a Russian spy
item.description: A campaign to protect a mysterious beluga whale near Norway is gathering pace - but will it work?

item.title: Why did a Nazi leader crash-land in Scotland?
item.description: One of the most bizarre episodes of World War Two unfolded on a farm to the south of Glasgow on 10 May 1941.

item.title: Arsenal 3-1 West Bromwich Albion: Baggies relegated after defeat
item.description: West Bromwich Albion are relegated from the Premier League for a fifth time after a 3-1 defeat against Arsenal at Emirates Stadium.

item.title: 'At least we don't travel back to a party on the Blue side' - Solskjaer happy to delay title celebrations
item.description: Manager Ole Gunnar Solskjaer says Manchester United will fight to delay Manchester City's Premier League title celebrations "as long as we can".

item.title: McIlroy wins at Quail Hollow for first title since 2019
item.description: Rory McIlroy ends his winless run by clinching the Wells Fargo Championship just six weeks after starting work with coach Pete Cowen.

item.title: Five defining games in Chelsea's WSL title triumph
item.description: After Chelsea successfully defender their Women's Super League title, which five games stand out as defining their season?

item.title: Race for top four - how are the contenders shaping up?
item.description: BBC Sport looks at each of the six sides still battling to qualify for the Champions League and how they are shaping up for the final push.

item.title: Saunders to have surgery on eye socket after loss to Alvarez
item.description: Billy Joe Saunders will have surgery on Sunday after suffering "multiple fractures" to his eye socket in his loss to Saul 'Canelo' Alvarez.

item.title: 2021 elections: What are the results in my area?
item.description: National elections in Scotland and Wales and local elections in England took place on 6 May 2021.

item.title: Election 2021: The four key takeaways in maps and charts
item.description: What have we learned after a bumper crop of elections?

item.title: Sir John Curtice: What the 2021 election results mean for the parties
item.description: Prof Sir John Curtice says the ruling parties appear to have done well in Thursday's bumper crop of elections.

item.title: Scottish independence: Could the Supreme Court rule on a referendum?
item.description: Scotland's First Minister Nicola Sturgeon wants a referendum on independence, but Boris Johnson does not.

item.title: Analysis: Is the Green Party on the rise - and if so, why?
item.description: Are the party's gains in Thursday's polls a flash in the pan or the start of something bigger, asks Chris Mason.

item.title: Scottish election 2021: Results in maps and charts
item.description: The picture across Scotland as the SNP win a fourth consecutive victory in the Scottish Parliament.

item.title: Welsh election results 2021: What's the secret behind Labour's success?
item.description: Labour's fortunes in Wales seem a world away from its troubles in England, what's going on?

item.title: Elections results 2021: Andy Burnham re-elected as Greater Manchester mayor
item.description: The Greater Manchester Mayor is the bookmakers' favourite to become the next Labour leader.

item.title: Elections 2021: Labour insiders on Starmer, what went wrong and how to fix it
item.description: Sir Keir Starmer took charge of Labour a year ago and has faced his first challenge at the polls.

item.title: Scottish election results: The story so far
item.description: The key results and moments from the first day of counting in the Holyrood election.

item.title: Election results 2021: When will we know who has won?
item.description: There could be a long wait for some results this year.

item.title: Elections 2021: How to follow the results on the BBC
item.description: Find out how to keep up to date with live election results on TV, radio, online and on social media.

item.title: What to expect in Scottish election
item.description: Scots have cast their votes, but they will not be counted until Friday and Saturday - when will the outcome be known?

item.title: Covid: What's the roadmap for lifting lockdown?
item.description: Northern Ireland is the latest part of the UK to lift some of the restrictions designed to stop the spread of Covid-19.

item.title: Covid: Should I be working from home or going back to the office?
item.description: As lockdown restrictions ease gradually across the UK, what are the rules about returning to work?

item.title: Covid: What are the social distancing rules and the rule of six?
item.description: Rules on hugging and social distancing in England are being reviewed.

item.title: Which countries are on the green list for foreign holidays?
item.description: A new "traffic light" system for travel classifies countries as green, amber or red.

item.title: Covid: When will I get the vaccine?
item.description: People 40 or over in England are now being offered a Covid vaccine as the rollout continues.

item.title: Covid-19 in the UK: How many coronavirus cases are there in your area?
item.description: Explore the data on coronavirus in the UK and find out how many cases there are in your area.

item.title: Covid vaccine: How many people in the UK have been vaccinated so far?
item.description: The logistics of vaccinating millions of people across the country, as more than 35 million people receive at least one dose.

item.title: UK holidays: When and where can I go.... and who with?
item.description: The rules on having a holiday in the UK have been relaxed - but restrictions remain.

item.title: What is a Covid passport and what are the plans for the NHS app?
item.description: The government is considering how people could prove they are unlikely to transmit Covid.

item.title: Covid: What refund rights are there for holidays abroad?
item.description: Quarantine-free overseas holidays will be possible after 17 May, but what rights do you have if plans or rules change?

item.title: Covid: How do I get a lateral flow or PCR test?
item.description: Everyone in England and Scotland is being encouraged to take rapid coronavirus tests regularly.
